show.title: The Ultimate Willy Wonka Party
show.headline: Scrumdiddlyumptious

event.title: <show-title>The Ultimate Willy Wonka Party</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: See Willy Wonka with Mike Teevee and Veruca Salt in person!
event.description:
Come with me, and you'll be in a wooorld of pure imagination...and you'll also be in a theater with two of the original kids from WILLY WONKA & THE CHOCOLATE FACTORY! We'll have a full Q&A after the screening, so you can ask Paris Themmen (Mike TeeVee) what it was like to be so tiny and ask Julie Dawn Cole (Veruca Salt) what happened after she got dumped down the Bad Egg chute.

Plus, are you a Wonka fanatic? Dress as your favorite character, set piece, or prop from the film and compete in our scrumdiddlyumptious gummy bear eating contest!

Whether you're a kid or just a kid at heart, this candy-colored movie is a delightful confection that you'll enjoy again and again. And for this screening, we're pulling out all the stops with custom chocolate bars (of course!), golden goose feathers, and a whole lot more. We'd hate to ruin it all for you, so sign the contract on the bottom line and enter the magical world of Willy Wonka…

eventType.title: Live Q&A
eventType.headline: Exclusive conversations with actors and filmmakers
eventType.description: Got a question for the director? Wanna meet the cast? At our special Live Q&A events, we follow the screening with an in-person discussion.

heroImage.altText: Event Category Web Hero Live QA 1920x1080

titleCardImage.altText: Live QA TC

show.title: Clue
show.headline: Seven suspects, six weapons, five bodies, and three endings

event.title: <show-title>Clue</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Mr. Boddy personally invites you to a killer party
event.description:
A mysterious invitation brings six strangers to a secluded mansion for an unconventional dinner party where each guest receives a pseudonym. As they learn more about their host, Mr. Boddy (Lee Ving, FLASHDANCE), via his butler, Wadsworth (Tim Curry, THE ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW), the group quickly realizes that Boddy has a devious plan in mind for all of them. And that’s when people start to die.

With a cast of comedy heavyweights including Madeline Kahn (YOUNG FRANKENSTEIN), Christopher Lloyd (BACK TO THE FUTURE), and Michael McKean (THIS IS SPINAL TAP), CLUE turns the classic, stuffy murder mystery on its head. Jam-packed with physical comedy, goofy puns, sexual innuendo, and twist upon twist upon twist, the film is a hilarious showcase for some of the best comic actors who ever lived.

And because this is a Movie Party, we’ll provide you with fun props and all sorts of blunt objects (that you didn't realize were weapons until your mom had to explain that you can actually kill anyone with basically anything) so that you can get in on all the murderous mayhem (note: please don’t murder anybody). You’ll have so much fun, you’ll feel fl-flame-flames! On the side of your face!

show.title: Sing-a-Long-a The Greatest Showman
show.headline: Ladies and gents, this is the movie party you've waited for

event.title: <show-title>Sing-a-Long-a The Greatest Showman</show-title> <event-type-title>Sing-Along</event-type-title>
event.headline: Ladies and gents, this is the movie party you've waited for
event.description:
Look out, 'cause here it comes...the smash hit musical "comes alive" like never before!

Inspired by the imagination of P.T. Barnum, THE GREATEST SHOWMAN is an original musical that celebrates the birth of show business and tells of a visionary who rose from nothing to create a spectacle that became a worldwide sensation.

Cheer on Hugh Jackman and wolf-whistle at Zac Efron as you experience THE GREATEST SHOWMAN in the greatest way possible...with interactive props, a themed menu, and lyrics on the screen so you can join in as loud as you want. Costumes are highly encouraged and full audience participation is essential.

eventType.title: Sing-Along
eventType.headline: Sing along to your favorite movie musicals
eventType.description: Celebrate your favorite movie musicals at our special Sing-Along screenings where we encourage the audience to join the chorus with on-screen lyrics. Vocal chops not required.

show.title: Cockfighter
show.headline: Monte Hellman's outsider masterpiece.

event.title: <show-title>Cockfighter</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Intro</event-type-title>
event.headline: 50th Anniversary screening of Monte Hellman's regional masterwork.
event.description:
Introduced by film historian Kier-La Janisse, who will be on hand with limited copies of her new book COCKFIGHT: A FABLE OF FAILURE.

In the Deep South, a trainer of fighting cocks takes a vow of silence and gambles his loves and possessions in a bid to win a championship. In short, that can encapsulate what happens in COCKFIGHTER, but like Monte Hellman's previous directorial effort, TWO-LANE BLACKTOP, that's only half the story. Diving deep into the subculture of cockfighting, Hellman's picture relishes in the quirks and rituals of its regionality, pairing seasoned character actors like Warren Oates and Harry Dean Stanton with real participants of the craft. As mysterious as its silent anti-hero, COCKFIGHTER is a snapshot of a particular place and time seldom captured in American cinema and a testament to the independent spirit of Hellman's body of work.

DCP courtesy of Shout! Factory.

contentBlocks.paragraphs: Introduced by film historian Kier-La Janisse, who will be on hand with very limited copies of her new book COCKFIGHT: A FABLE OF FAILURE.

In the Deep South, a trainer of fighting cocks takes a vow of silence and gambles his loves and possessions in a bid to win a championship. In short, that can encapsulate what happens in COCKFIGHTER, but like Monte Hellman's previous directorial effort, TWO-LANE BLACKTOP, that's only half the story. Diving deep into the subculture of cockfighting, Hellman's picture relishes in the quirks and rituals of its regionality, pairing seasoned character actors like Warren Oates and Harry Dean Stanton with real participants of the craft. As mysterious as its silent anti-hero, COCKFIGHTER is a snapshot of a particular place and time seldom captured in American cinema and a testament to the independent spirit of Hellman's body of work.

DCP courtesy of Shout! Factory.

eventType.description: What better way is there to understand a film to have it prefaced by the artist who made it? At our Live Intro screenings, we invite filmmakers and talent to stop by before a film to provide something we could all use a little more of – perspective.

show.title: Beetlejuice
show.headline: We dare you to say his name three times

event.title: <show-title>Beetlejuice</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Haunt along with the ghost with the most, babes
event.description:
Betelgeuse, Betelgeuse…BETELGEUSE! Well, we’ve summoned him, guess we might as well throw a Movie Party for him.

BEETLEJUICE is the timeless tale of a ghostly couple and the troublesome “bio-exorcist” they employ to help scare away the living inhabiting their house. It’s megawatt Michael Keaton at his kookiest, Winona Ryder, Alec Baldwin, and Geena Davis at their dreamiest, and vintage Tim Burton from start to finish.

Resurrect the undead fun with spooky props galore and all kinds of delights for the Recently Deceased. This ghoulishly interactive screening comes with Miss Argentina sashes, shrimp keychains, BEETLEJUICE stickers, and even sticky eyeballs. Btw, if you feel an uncontrollable urge to Day-o (the banana song), that’s normal.

show.title: The Rocky Horror Picture Show
show.headline: Do the time warp with us, again

landscapeHeroImage.altText: A53 EGF0 Nz HRG Ku R Itsrt XBM8 FCD

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW portrait

event.title: <show-title>The Rocky Horror Picture Show</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Don’t dream it, be it…at our ROCKY HORROR Movie Party
event.description:
Now, at long last, the antici...pation is over! As the cult of ROCKY HORROR nears its fifth decade, Alamo Drafthouse's celebration of this pioneer of interactive movies has incorporated new breakthroughs, elusive ingredients, and that... SPARK which will make the RHPS experience better than ever!

Now, we know that some ROCKY HORROR screenings can become a little too focused on yelling out those callbacks, so our hosts will make sure we strike a good balance between having some interactive fun while also allowing everyone to enjoy the movie on its own terms.

But we also know that the key to the perfect ROCKY HORROR screening is to have fun and live the movie. With thrilling props (including squirt guns, noisemakers, party hats, inflatable saxophones, and more), the most outrageous callbacks, boisterous sing-alongs, and stimulating pre-show games, our Movie Party will be your ultimate ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW – whether this is your first or 500th viewing.

show.title: Point Break (1991)
show.headline: Little hand says it's time to rock and roll

show.title: Batman Forever
show.headline: Courage now, truth always, Batman forever!

event.title: <show-title>Batman Forever</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Party harder than the Batsuit’s nipples
event.description:
Tommy Lee Jones famously told Jim Carrey during the making of BATMAN FOREVER, “I cannot sanction your buffoonery,” but all buffoonery is sanctioned at our campy Movie Party.

In 1995, the Bat-franchise was handed to director Joel Schumacher (THE LOST BOYS), who assembled Val Kilmer, Chris O’Donnell, Jim Carrey, Tommy Lee Jones, and Nicole Kidman for a flamboyant and altogether '90s take on the caped crusader. The soundtrack plays like a 1995 greatest hits album, with killer tracks from Seal, U2, The Offspring, and Brandy.

Join in the fun with themed props like a custom Two-Face coin, custom tube socks, and a bat-shaped sticky toy that you can use as a batarang. Be sure to arrive early and compete in the “Laundry Karate” contest, where you can high kick clothes along with Chris O’Donnell in the iconic movie scene.

show.title: Grease
show.headline: Summer lovin' lives on in this quintessential movie musical celebrating the '50s

event.title: <show-title>Grease</show-title> <event-type-title>Sing-Along Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Warm up your pipes for a systematic, hydromatic sing-along
event.description:
We’re hopelessly devoted to GREASE, with its lovable characters, doo-wop style, and, of course, those endlessly catchy tunes. To celebrate this timeless classic, we’re putting together an interactive, prop-filled, hand-jiving Sing-Along Movie Party for all you T-Birds and Pink Ladies out there (beauty school dropouts also welcome).

We’ll kick things off with a pre-show hand jive contest before we start the interactive show, where you’ll have some candy cigarettes to help you look like a greaser, a comb so that you can comb along to the action, pom poms in Rydell High colors, and beauty caps to help you get the perfect ‘do. And because this is a Sing-Along, we’ll have the lyrics up onscreen to help every Danny, Sandy, Rizzo, and Kenickie in the audience get in on the fun.

So roll up the cuffs on those jeans, grab your respective black leather and pink satin jackets, theatrically comb your hair, and cruise on down to join us for the most rockin’ Sing-Along Movie Party ever.

DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Grease Sing Along Web SHOW Hero 1920x1080 v3

posterImage.altText: Grease Sing Along Web SHOW P 960x1400

show.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
show.headline: Darkness will descend

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Hp prisoner of azkaban sp hero

portraitHeroImage.altText: Hp prisoner of azkaban sp hero

posterImages.altText: Hp prisoner of az sp poster

event.title: <show-title>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wands up for a magical screening of Harry's time-twisting adventure
event.description:
Accio the best Harry Potter movie ever! Accio awesome themed props! Accio a theater full of awesome Potter heads! There, that should just about summon everything we need for a magical Movie Party for Alfonso Cuarón’s chillingly fun vision of Harry’s third year at Hogwarts, HARRY POTTER AND THE PRISONER OF AZKABAN.

Things get a little dark for our trio of newly teenaged wizards, with Hermione coming to the disturbing revelation that even she might not be able to handle taking every class at once. Oh, and there’s a shape-shifting prison escapee on the hunt for Harry with murderous intent. We made sure to stop by Diagon Alley for all of the school supplies you’ll need, including wind-up rats, custom tattoo sheets, Time Turner necklaces, and custom tea bags. And since we want this party to be as magical as possible, we encourage all of you witches and wizards to bring your wands to the show.

show.title: Phantasm
show.headline: See Don Coscarelli's waking nightmare, if you dare

portraitHeroImage.altText: G Id KN3l Hzwlhl P7 VQ4 NR7 H Lpa Iv

event.title: <show-title>Phantasm</show-title>
event.headline: See Don Coscarelli's waking nightmare, if you dare
event.description:
If watching PHANTASM is like experiencing a waking nightmare – strange, unexplainable, gleefully deranged – it's a nightmare you never want to wake up from.

A group of small-town friends must band together to stop the Tall Man, a mysterious force of cosmic horror, and his dimension-hopping schemes as he unleashes his deadly silver Sentinel Spheres among any unlucky enough to enter the boogeyman's mausoleum.

Written, produced, directed, shot, and edited by horror auteur Don Coscarelli when he was only 23 years old, PHANTASM deftly mixes gothic horror, sci-fi, surrealism, and a killer prog rock score together in a grief-ridden adolescent fever dream that horror fans have never stopped worshipping.

Forty years after its release, PHANTASM has never looked or sounded better thanks to a stunning new remaster and a 5.1 surround sound mix produced by J.J. Abrams' Bad Robot and Coscarelli. Don't miss your chance to rediscover one of the scariest films ever unleashed upon the unprepared collective mind of humanity.

DCP courtesy of the American Genre Film Archive and Arrow Video

show.title: Ghostbusters (1984)
show.headline: Cross the streams into a spectral-blast of fun

event.title: <show-title>Ghostbusters (1984)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Classic movie, interactive props…mass hysteria!
event.description:
For 40 years, GHOSTBUSTERS has held a special place in the hearts of moviegoers with its eye-popping special effects, iconic characters, and, of course, its cast of comedy heavyweights led by Bill Murray. So we want to show our love for this beloved blockbuster by throwing an epically spooky movie party.

We’ll have a bunch of ghostly goodies to help you get in on the fun, including some slime from Slimer himself, some Stay Puft marshmallows, and some glow necklaces you can wave around anytime the Ghostbusters use their proton packs (just don’t cross the streams).

Join us and cheer on Peter, Ray, Egon, and Winston in the fight against the slimy, spooky, supernatural spirits haunting New York City in this hilarious ’80s classic.

eventType.description: Spanning all genres, Alamo Drafthouse Movie Parties are an immersive, interactive experience for cinema fans featuring fun props, themed drinks, and more.

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: The Brood
show.headline: The ultimate experience in inner terror!

event.title: <show-title>The Brood</show-title>
event.headline: They're her children…the children of her rage
event.description:
"THE BROOD is my version of KRAMER VS. KRAMER, but more realistic." – David Cronenberg

It’s spooky season, and that means it’s psychotherapy time…or rather “psychoplasmics” time at Queer Film Theory 101! We’re headed out for a little self-reflection at The Somafree Institute of Psychoplasmatics in David Cronenberg’s most personal and serious film THE BROOD from 1979. It’s MARRIAGE STORY on mescaline! Developed in the wake of Cronenberg’s difficult divorce, THE BROOD is a startling interrogation into cycles of abuse, patriarchy, and the destruction of the nuclear family, complete with tiny murder goblins! Gorgeous Diva Nola Carveth (the iconic Samantha Eggar) is an unstable and traumatized woman undergoing intense and experimental therapy with Dr. Hal Raglan (Oliver Reed giving stunt daddy realness) at his private institute. As a custody battle between Nola and her ineffectual milquetoast ex-husband Frank (Art Hindle) intensifies, strange murders begin to occur, revealing a terrifying and bizarre manifestation of trauma and rage. Toxic gender roles, parental failure, and pedophobia (fear of children) are all present in THE BROOD, a movie that posits “maybe heterosexuality is bad?” This gorgeous and provocative melodrama was released to both praise and claims of virulent misogyny and gynophobia, leaving its legacy complicated, but we never shy away from complications here at QFT101! No spoilers, but we’re on the woman’s side. Justice for Nola. These men done did her dirty. Come hang out with us for a night of processing and body horror – if you still want to get married and have kids after watching this movie, that is wild.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Warriors
show.headline: Come out and play-ay-ay-ayyy...

event.title: <show-title>The Warriors</show-title>
event.headline: “These are the armies of the night”
event.description: WARRIORS…come out and GAAAY! That’s right, we’re back on our Walter Hill shit with 1979’s THE WARRIORS, the most important film ever made about New York fashionista street gangs! Cyrus, mother of the house of Gramercy Riffs, the most powerful gang in New York, summons delegates from each of the city's crews to Cortlandt Park for a summit to discuss their collective power over the NYPD. BUT oh no – Cyrus is shot and the blame is pinned on the leather-vested Coney Island gang The Warriors. Will these hunky anti-heroes manage to make it from The Bronx back to Coney Island, or will they fall to swift and color-coordinated gang justice on their journey? Developed from Sol Yurick’s significantly more complicated novel of the same name, THE WARRIORS is a queer, stylish, and entertaining romp through a bygone era of New York’s underground. I mean, it’s all based on Xenophon's Anabasis and it doesn’t get much gayer than ancient Greece. Don’t even get me started on the lesbian-coded all-girl gang called “The Lizzies,” because then we’ll be here all night. And wait, who is that mysterious DJ who appears from time to time in the film to provide narrative updates and needle drops? That’s Lynne Thigpen from Where In The World Is Carmen Sandiego? The one and only. A queer icon! If you’ve never had a chance to watch THE WARRIORS on the big screen, now’s your chance to seize the night! Don’t miss your chance to see the film that answered the question, “Wait, what if the Villiage People were a street gang?”

show.title: Rango
show.headline: Heroes come in all different colors

show.title: A Girl Walks Home Alone at Night
show.headline: The first Iranian vampire western

landscapeHeroImage.altText: A GIRL WALKS HOME ALONE AT NIGHT

portraitHeroImage.altText: A GIRL WALKS HOME ALONE AT NIGHT

posterImages.altText: A GIRL WALKS HOME ALONE AT NIGHT

event.title: <show-title>A Girl Walks Home Alone at Night</show-title>
event.headline: The first psych-out Iranian vampire western.
event.description:
Presented in Farsi with English subtitles

Strange things are afoot in Bad City. The Iranian ghost town, home to prostitutes, junkies, pimps, and other sordid souls, is a place that reeks of death and hopelessness, where a lonely vampire is stalking the town's most unsavory inhabitants. But when boy meets girl, an unusual love story begins to blossom...blood red.

The first Iranian vampire western, Ana Lily Amirpour's debut feature basks in the sheer pleasure of pulp. A joyful mash-up of genre, archetype, and iconography, its prolific influences span spaghetti westerns, graphic novels, horror films, and the Iranian New Wave. Amped by a mix of Iranian rock, techno, and Morricone-inspired riffs, its airy, anamorphic, black-and-white aesthetic and artfully drawn-out scenes combine the simmering tension of Sergio Leone with the weird surrealism of David Lynch.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Basket Case
show.headline: Frank Henenlotter's malignant gutter horror classic

event.title: <show-title>Basket Case</show-title>
event.headline: 4K restoration of the underground horror classick
event.description:
BASKET CASE is the debut trash-art symphony from Frank Henenlotter (FRANKENHOOKER), stealthily filmed in the gutters of Times Square and chock-full of fury. Duane and his brother Belial are ex-Siamese twins who arrive in New York on a quest for homicidal revenge. The only catch is that Belial is a telepathic monstrosity who lives in a wicker basket. With its demented gore, unreal stop motion animation, and real-life NYC sleazers, BASKET CASE is an essential underground horror classick – now restored in 4K by the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA).

Screening the 4K restoration

Content Warning: This movie contains a scene that depicts a non-consensual sexual act.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Bram Stoker's Dracula (1992)
show.headline: Coppola’s wild, bloody take on everyone’s favorite vampire

event.title: <show-title>Bram Stoker's Dracula (1992)</show-title>
event.headline: A gothic dreamscape from Francis Ford Coppola
event.description:
Both a remake of DRACULA (1931) and a direct adaptation of the original novel, BRAM STOKER’S DRACULA is a sumptuous carnival ride that finds Dracula (Gary Oldman) spanning space and time to seduce Mina (Winona Ryder), the woman he believes to be his true love – even though her heart belongs to Jonathan (Keanu Reeves). Easily one of the most accomplished gothic horror spectacles in history and a true feast for the senses, Francis Ford Coppola’s film embraces excess, camp, and over-sexed madness with equal measure. There’s nothing else like it.

Screening an archival 35mm print.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Maniac Cop
show.headline: Genre legends Bill Lustig and Larry Cohen light Dirty Old New York ablaze.

event.title: <show-title>Maniac Cop</show-title>
event.headline: Genre legends Bill Lustig and Larry Cohen light Dirty Old New York ablaze.
event.description:
Blasting from the minds of exploitation legends William Lustig (MANIAC) and Larry Cohen (IT’S ALIVE), MANIAC COP is a brilliant action-slasher that's finally back where it belongs—on the big screen. Matt Cordell (Robert Z'Dar, SAMURAI COP) is a murderous ex-cop who's back from the dead and out for revenge. But first, he'll have to deal with super cops Jack Forrest (Bruce Campbell, EVIL DEAD) and Frank McCrae (Tom Atkins, NIGHT OF THE CREEPS). MANIAC COP is an ultra-violent, live-action cartoon for adults that feels like a glorious mash-up of HALLOWEEN and THE TERMINATOR. But it also serves as a prescient exploration of police corruption. Basically, this is a slasher with brains—both figuratively and literally.

DCP courtesy of the American Genre Film Archive.

show.title: Resident Evil
show.headline: A secret experiment. A deadly virus. A fatal mistake.

event.title: <show-title>Resident Evil</show-title>
event.headline: Visit Raccoon City
event.description: RESIDENT EVIL is one of the most satisfying, pulse-pounding, and joyous video game adaptations of all time. An ultra-stylized banger from director Paul W.S. Anderson (EVENT HORIZON, MORTAL KOMBAT), the film strikes a perfect balance between the survival horror vibes of the original PlayStation game and big-screen spectacle. But the real power of RESIDENT EVIL lies in the fierce tag team of Milla Jovovich and Michelle Rodriguez, who lead the movie – and obliterate zombies – with unleashed fury. We’d follow them to the ends of the apocalypse.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Séance (2000)
show.headline: Kurosawa’s bewitching ghost story

event.title: <show-title>Séance (2000)</show-title>
event.headline: Kurosawa’s bewitching ghost story
event.description:
Screening in Japanese with English subtitles

Between CURE and PULSE, there was SÉANCE – an unheralded J-horror haunting from filmmaker Kiyoshi Kurosawa. Junko, a psychic, and her husband Sato, a movie sound engineer, are in a rut. But everything changes when Junko’s powers lead her to a horrifying discovery in the couple’s garage. Shot in two weeks on gritty 16mm film stock and originally made for Japanese television, SÉANCE weaves true crime thrills, supernatural phenomena, and technological angst through a raw tapestry of human (and non-human) emotions. Never screened in North American theaters, this is a bewitching ghost story like no other.

show.title: The Gates of Hell
show.headline: Lucio Fulci’s surrealist nightmare

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE GATES OF HELL (aka CITY OF THE LIVING DEAD)

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE GATES OF HELL (aka CITY OF THE LIVING DEAD)

posterImages.altText: THE GATES OF HELL (aka CITY OF THE LIVING DEAD)

event.title: <show-title>The Gates of Hell</show-title>
event.headline: Lucio Fulci’s surrealist nightmare
event.description: Words like “inspiring” and “life-altering” aren’t typically used to describe a movie with a scene where someone vomits up their own digestive tract. But this is THE GATES OF HELL (aka CITY OF THE LIVING DEAD), and there’s nothing typical about it. The first entry in Lucio Fulci’s “Gates of Hell” trilogy, this benchmark in Italian horror is one of the most unforgettable mash-ups of zombies, H.P. Lovecraft-inspired mythology, and ferocious gore that will ever cross your punctured eyeballs. The thunderous prog-synth score from Fabio Frizzi is the icing on the maggot-filled cake.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Hunger
show.headline: Nothing human loves forever

event.title: <show-title>The Hunger</show-title>
event.headline: Vamp out with David Bowie
event.description: Before THE CROW and BRAM STOKER'S DRACULA inspired goths the world over, there was THE HUNGER – a hyper-stylized vampire triumph from director Tony Scott (TOP GUN, TRUE ROMANCE). The story follows vampire lovers Miriam (Catherine Deneuve) and John (David Bowie) as they feed on victims in NYC nightclubs. But when John begins to physically deteriorate, Miriam seduces Sarah (Susan Sarandon), a doctor who may or may not hold the key to their destruction. A chilling art-horror film that sparkles with early MTV vibes, skin-tight black leather, and gorgeous humans, THE HUNGER is an essential snapshot of 1980s decadence.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Masque of the Red Death
show.headline: A prince terrorizes local peasants while taking refuge against the plague

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH

posterImages.altText: THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH

event.title: <show-title>The Masque of the Red Death</show-title>
event.headline: A prince terrorizes local peasants while taking refuge against the plague
event.description: Nobody wears a pair of tights like Vincent Price. With THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH, Price and director Roger Corman solidified a creative blood pact over the works of Edgar Allan Poe that will never be surpassed. In this seventh – and best – of eight collaborations, Price plays Prince Prospero, a loveable rat bastard who finds that his castle has become a refuge for peasants that are damned by a plague called the Red Death. Of course, this can only lead to torture, murder, and mod superstar Jane Asher running rampant through sets that look like they escaped from Mario Bava’s darkest nightmares. THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH cuddles us with an intense wickedness while providing a backdrop for Price to scold, scoff, and gouge his way through one of the most iconic and unstoppable performances of his career. And the best part? They do it all for Satan. (Joseph A. Ziemba)

show.title: The Deer Hunter
show.headline: Three men's lives are forever changed after fighting in the Vietnam War

show.title: Blood for Dracula
show.headline: The high art '70s Euroshocker returns.

event.title: <show-title>Blood for Dracula</show-title>
event.headline: The high art '70s Euroshocker returns.
event.description:
“It has obvious appeal for the lover of Grand Guignol, but it equally addresses the thoughtful.” — Maurice Yacowar, THE CRITERION COLLECTION

Immediately after completing FLESH FOR FRANKENSTEIN, filmmaker Paul Morrissey and star Udo Kier created BLOOD FOR DRACULA, a sumptuously depraved Euroshocker that tows the line between art and bad taste. Desperate for virgin blood, Count Dracula (Kier) journeys to an Italian villa only to discover the family’s three young daughters are also coveted by the estate’s Marxist stud (Joe Dallesandro of Morrissey’s FLESH, TRASH, and HEAT). Stefania Casini (SUSPIRIA) and BICYCLE THIEVES director Vittorio De Sica co-star in one of the most unique and outrageous vampire films in history, now scanned uncut in 4K from the original negative for the first time ever.

DCP courtesy of Vinegar Syndrome and the American Genre Film Archive.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Death Proof
show.headline: Quentin Tarantino's revved-up revenge picture.

event.title: <show-title>Death Proof</show-title>
event.headline: Quentin Tarantino's revved-up revenge picture.
event.description:
Rooted in a dreamspace of regional stunt-driven programmers from the '70s, gialli, and time spent in Austin, Texas, DEATH PROOF both stands as the B-picture to the two-fisted feature GRINDHOUSE and a standalone achievement in its own right. Quentin Tarantino's obsessions with kitsch, dialogue, and world-building all distill into a fully-formed fetish object, all anchored by an instantly-iconic performance by Kurt Russell as Stuntman Mike and a gallery of engaging actresses (including Rosario Dawson, Vanessa Ferlito, Zoë Bell, and more).

Presented in its extended International Cut.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Head
show.headline: The Monkees’ absurd counterculture comedy

event.title: <show-title>Head</show-title>
event.headline: The Monkees’ absurd counterculture comedy in 35mm
event.description:
“Manufactured culture achieves self-awareness; blows up, blows out, leaks from the screen, and eats its own tail. Somewhere between concerted career destruction and gleeful cinematic anarchy; either way the joint's a real treat to watch.” – Morgan Hyde, Letterboxd

“You can see its influence in all kinds of absurdist comedy: Mel Brooks, Mr. Show, ZAZ movies, SCTV, practically everything good.” – Travis Vogt, Letterboxd

Made-for-TV pop group The Monkees turn a funhouse mirror on themselves in this radical, psychedelic, New Hollywood hand grenade. Reportedly fueled by marijuana, LSD, and good old-fashioned irreverence, budding young actor/writer Jack Nicholson collaborated with The Monkees creator/BBS Productions co-founder/director Bob Rafelson (FIVE EASY PIECES) in crafting this kaleidoscopic pop art masterpiece. “I thought I would never get to make another movie, so I might as well make fifty to start out with and put them all in the same feature,” said Rafleson about HEAD.

Don’t miss this rare opportunity to see an archived 35mm print of this 1968 classic on the big screen!

show.title: Hey Folks! It's the Intermission Time Mixtape
show.headline: A mind-altering mixtape from AGFA

landscapeHeroImage.altText: HEY FOLKS! IT'S THE INTERMISSION TIME MIXTAPE

portraitHeroImage.altText: HEY FOLKS! IT'S THE INTERMISSION TIME MIXTAPE

posterImages.altText: HEY FOLKS! IT'S THE INTERMISSION TIME MIXTAPE

event.title: <show-title>Hey Folks! It's the Intermission Time Mixtape</show-title>
event.headline: A mind-altering mixtape from AGFA
event.description:
Mid-century America runs amok in this haunted found-footage ode to moviegoing and the snack bar. In the tradition of Negativland and Devo, AGFA’s archival gremlins have spun a mountain of vintage cinema and drive-in ads (courtesy of Something Weird Video) into satanic word salad. Beneath, behind, and between the movies lie carbonized hot dogs from Hades, velvety vapid voiceovers, bewitching graphics, and pizza from the eighth dimension. Take a psychedelic trip to the lobby with us. (AGFA)

DCP courtesy of the American Genre Film Archive

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Supergirl
show.headline: Her cousin is Superman!

event.title: <show-title>Supergirl</show-title>
event.headline: Bronze Age heroics in 35mm.
event.description: Travel back to a time when superhero movies weren't so popular or cool. There were no dark, gritty versions of superheroes, and only three dominant ages of comic books (golden, silver and bronze) to call upon for source material. Travel back to a time when SUPERGIRL could be made. This unapologetically dorky cousin to the concurrent Christopher Reeves SUPERMAN movies has long been dragged for its low budget and frequent goofiness, but what some saw as flaws, we say are features: this movie is a charm bomb that transcends comparison to anything but a second hand, one-shot comic book purchased at a flea market because it had a neat cover. Helen Slater (LEGEND OF BILLIE JEAN) stars as the Kryptonian hero with a heart of gold, and thanks to a witch's spell, a hunky love interest. It's good clean fun, even as the witch (played with an appropriate amount of ham, corn and camp by Faye Dunaway) seeks to take over a small town in Indiana and the fate of an entire planet hangs in the balance.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Linguini Incident - Director's Cut
show.headline: David Bowie stars in this underrated screwball romance.

event.title: <show-title>The Linguini Incident - Director's Cut</show-title>
event.headline: David Bowie stars in this underrated screwball romance.
event.description:
Lucy (Rosanna Arquette) is an under-paid, under-appreciated waitress at a terminally hip NYC restaurant called Dali. She’s also an aspiring escape artist desperately in need of cash to buy Harry Houdini’s wedding ring. Monte (David Bowie) is the shady but charming new bartender who desperately needs to get married at any cost. Together they join forces— along with Lucy’s best friend, the self-defense bra designing Viv (Eszter Balint)— to rob the popular restaurant, and all the “trend-sucking leeches” who dine there. As one might expect, it doesn’t go as planned, but that’s not necessarily a bad thing. Funny, romantic, and wonderfully odd, the cult classic The Linguini Incident, co-starring Andre Gregory, Buck Henry, and Marlee Matlin, is “an off the wall treat,” according to the LA Times. “A contemporary screwball comedy that actually works.”

4k DCP courtesy of the filmmaker.

show.title: The Sweet East
show.headline: A teenager embarks on a fractured road trip in search of America

event.title: <show-title>The Sweet East</show-title>
event.headline: They've all come to look for America.
event.description:
THE SWEET EAST is a picaresque journey through the cities and woods of the Eastern seaboard of the United States. Lillian, a high school senior from South Carolina, gets her first glimpse of the wider world on a class trip to Washington, D.C. Separated from her schoolmates, she embarks on a fractured road trip in search of America. Along the way, she falls in with a variety of strange factions, each living out their own alternative realities in our present day. Also starring Jacob Elordi, Ayo Edebiri, Simon Rex, and Gibby Haynes.

35mm print courtesy of Utopia Releasing.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Zodiac Killer
show.headline: A serial killer murders without motive or pattern and taunts the police

event.title: <show-title>The Zodiac Killer</show-title>
event.headline: A serial killer murders without motive or pattern and taunts the police
event.description:
If you’ve ever wanted proof that the world is insane, you’ve found it. Directed by Tom Hanson, who had previously owned a chain of Pizza Man restaurants, THE ZODIAC KILLER was made to capture the real-life Zodiac Killer. That plan didn’t work. Instead, we got the most outrageous and compelling "tabloid horror" vortex in the history of planet Earth. And beyond. During theatrical screenings, Hanson constructed in-theater "traps" to lure the killer from hiding. These included the use of an ice cream freezer filled with rent-a-cops and a raffle with a motorcycle as a prize. You won’t get insight like this by watching a David Fincher movie. But you will get it while watching the nihilistic, no-budget majesty of THE ZODIAC KILLER. (Joseph A. Ziemba)

4K digital transfer from the American Genre Film Archive and Something Weird!

show.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
show.headline: The Ghost with the Most is back

event.title: <show-title>Beetlejuice Beetlejuice</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: There ain't no party like an afterlife party
event.description:
Movie party…movie party…movie party. Welp, guess it’s official now – we have to throw a BEETLEJUICE BEETLEJUICE Movie Party.

We’re celebrating the Ghost with the Most’s return with a super fun screening complete with themed props we plucked straight from the afterlife. Chow down on cockroaches (don’t really though, they’re not real, and also don’t eat real ones, gross), ring fingers, afterlife name tags, black and white ribbon dancers that may or may not be sandworms, and light-up gravestone keychains so you can always find your keys’ final resting place.

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
Movie party…movie party…movie party. Welp, guess it’s official now – we have to throw a BEETLEJUICE BEETLEJUICE Movie Party.

We’re celebrating the Ghost with the Most’s return with a super fun screening complete with themed props we plucked straight from the afterlife. Chow down on cockroaches (don’t really though, they’re not real, and also don’t eat real ones, gross), ring fingers, afterlife name tags, black and white ribbon dancers that may or may not be sandworms, and light-up gravestone keychains so you can always find your keys’ final resting place.

show.title: Ginger Snaps
show.headline: They don't call it the curse for nothing

event.title: <show-title>Ginger Snaps</show-title>
event.headline: The feminist werewolf parable for the 21st Century.
event.description:
"A perfect women's horror picture." - Willow Maclay, Letterboxd

One of the dumbest prejudices perpetuated by the world is that menstrual cycles turn women into monsters. That conceit is what makes GINGER SNAPS so incredible. The Fitzgerald sisters are death-obsessed high school goths who create ultra-violent art projects while battling the popular kids. But everything changes when someone’s period -- and a werewolf -- enters the picture. Combining the revisionist energy of AN AMERICAN WEREWOLF IN LONDON, the body-horror of SHIVERS, and the black humor of HAROLD AND MAUDE, GINGER SNAPS is unpredictable and unbelievably fun -- taking gender norms down a peg with lycanthropic glory.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
